column4: Line 55 of your /etc/apt/sources.list file is not correct. Fix it, or copy the file to http://paste.ubuntu.com/ and I'll tell you how to do so.
It's posted to the pastebin, name Malel Draconis
given that it's an error on line 55, and there's 50 lines in that pastebin, this is odd.
yeah, .list and .save files for Wine, Chrome, and Pidgin...
run "cat /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*" and copy the output to pastebin
last line of sources.list should have a space between "canonical.com/" and "lucid". fix that and try apt-get update again.
access denied, I can't edit it, and I don't remember how to do it from terminal
ok, so I'm being a total noob, I know, but I thought ^ meant the Shift key... and how do I save the file in nano?
Ctrl-O, or Ctrl-X to quit and prompt to save
oh, duh. You can just delete that last line altogether, it duplicates the one above it
thanks, alot, this helps alot of issues I've been having
